snippet: Insurgents opposed to the Islamic State said the group was exploiting Syrian government airstrikes against them to seize areas near Aleppo.
abstract: Syrian opposition forces contend Islamic State militants are seizing territory in advance toward Aleppo, aided by collaboration with government forces of Pres Bashar al-Assad; situation underscores complexity of Syria's multifaceted war and challenges it poses for United States policy.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Maher Samaan and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; Karam Shoumali from Istanbul; Alissa J. Rubin from Paris; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Insurgents opposed to the Islamic State said the group was exploiting Syrian government airstrikes against them to seize areas near Aleppo.

headline.main: Assad’s Forces May Be Aiding New ISIS Surge
headline.print_headline: Assad’s Forces May Be Aiding New ISIS Surge

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
